main_page.title: Entering AustraliaEntering Australia
main_page.summary: The page provides an overview of what travellers should expect when entering Australia, including border processes, visa information, and rules on what can be brought into the country. It highlights biosecurity requirements, duty-free allowances, and resources for determining visa options.

topics.border_expectations: Information on what to expect when crossing the Australian border.
topics.visa_information: Guidance on visa requirements for visiting, studying or working.
topics.crew_and_special_entry: Information for air/sea crew, offshore workers, and military personnel.
topics.biosecurity_and_restrictions: Rules on what travellers can and cannot bring into Australia.
topics.duty_free_allowances: Details on duty-free limits for personal goods, alcohol, and tobacco.

duty_free_information.description: Most personal luggage items are tax and duty free; limited amounts of general goods, alcohol, and tobacco can be brought in duty free.

structured_data.biosecurity_notes: Australia enforces strict biosecurity rules restricting certain items from entry.

child_pages.title: Entering AustraliaEntering Australia
child_pages.summary: This page provides an overview of what travellers should expect when entering Australia, including border procedures and rules about what can be brought into the country. It highlights visa information, biosecurity restrictions, and duty‑free allowances for travellers.

topics_covered: Entry processes for air/sea crew, offshore workers, and military personnel
Biosecurity rules on what can and cannot be brought into Australia

what_you_can_bring_in.description: Explains restrictions on items travellers may bring into Australia and outlines strict biosecurity requirements.
what_you_can_bring_in.cta: See what you can bring in

duty_free.description: Most personal luggage items can be brought in duty free; limited quantities of general goods, alcohol, and tobacco may also be purchased duty free.

visa_information.description: Travellers can use the visa finder tool to determine appropriate visa options for visiting, studying, or working in Australia.

child_pages.title: Entering AustraliaEntering Australia
child_pages.summary: This page provides general information about entering Australia, including what to expect at the border, visa options, and what travellers can bring into the country. It highlights biosecurity rules, duty‑free allowances, and links to detailed guidance on visas and border processes.

topics.border_expectations: Information on what happens when you cross the border into Australia.
topics.visa_information: Guidance on finding the correct visa for visiting, studying, or working.
topics.what_you_can_bring: Rules about items allowed or prohibited, including biosecurity requirements.
topics.duty_free: Information on duty-free allowances for luggage, general goods, alcohol, and tobacco.
topics.entry_for_specific_roles: Guidance for air or sea crew, offshore workers, and military personnel.

key_points.biosecurity: Strict requirements apply; travellers must be aware of prohibited and restricted items.
key_points.duty_free_allowance: Most personal items are tax- and duty-free; limited amounts of general goods, alcohol, and tobacco may also be bought duty-free.

page_metadata.title: Entering Australia
page_metadata.summary: Information for travellers entering Australia, including border expectations, visa requirements, what can be brought into the country, biosecurity rules, and duty‑free allowances. Includes guidance for specific traveller groups such as air/sea crew, offshore workers, and military personnel.

border_expectations.description: Information on what to expect when crossing the Australian border, including entry processes and border procedures.

visa_information.description: Guidance on visa requirements for visiting, studying, or working in Australia. Travellers can use the visa finder tool to determine appropriate visa options.

entry_for_specific_roles.description: Entry guidance for specialised travellers including air and sea crew, offshore workers, and military personnel.

biosecurity_and_restrictions.description: Information on strict biosecurity rules that govern what can and cannot be brought into Australia.
biosecurity_and_restrictions.notes: Travellers must be aware of prohibited and restricted items.
biosecurity_and_restrictions.cta: See what you can bring in

duty_free_allowances.description: Most personal luggage items are tax and duty free. Limited amounts of general goods, alcohol, and tobacco can also be brought in or purchased duty free.
